strings.string: \rThe door is locked.\r
\rThe door opens.\r
\rThe door didn't open.\r
\rAs you exit the from the tunnel, you startle a sleeping hobo and he runs off.\r
\rYou swim next to the edge.\r
\rGlub, glub!\r
\rGoing into a tunnel.\r
\rYou are having trouble keeping your head above water.\r
\rYou swim with ease.\r
\rYou are on the deck beside the pool.\r
\rOn the table are food wrappers, bottles, ashtrays and roaches.\r
\rThe litter is revolting and the stench makes you sick.\r
\rIt's covered with fingerprints but you spot one unopened bottle.\r
\rA chair slumps by the wall.\r
\rA dingy bed leans on the wall. Its legs barely hold it up.\r
\rA sign reads: CLOSED.\r
\rThere is a lobby desk here with a sleepy local behind it. A wood railing splits the room.\r
The clerk asks, "Looking for INFO or a ROOM?"\r
INFO
ROOM
\r"Rooms cost $50," he says. "No charge for that!"\r
\r"Here is your key, Room 10."\r
\r"Eh? I didn't catch that. Left ear is a bit deaf."\r
\rA clerk works near the files.\r
\rThe wood railing is in your way.\r
\rYou pass the railing.\r
\rYou wrench your back trying, but the railing is still in your way.\r
\rThe carpet is bloodstained.\r
\rA bloody sign reads: CLOSED. Step to your left.\r
\rThe dying clerk groans, "The booby trap will getcha!"\r
\rThis file cabinet is locked.\r
\rYou notice a twist of wire and suspect that doing the wrong thing will blow it.\r
\rFortunately, you traced the right wire and disarmed it.\r
\rThe lock opens. There are hotel records, a cash box, and an item of real interest...\r
\rWelcome to Stagecoach Inn.\r
\rThe sign above the door says LOBBY.\r
\rThe sign on the saloon door says Cookie's Chuckwagon.\r
\rYou are in the diner. The place looks deserted.\r
\rThis table is covered with dirty dishes.\r
\rThe glass is greasy with fish oil and the plate is covered with fish bones.\r
\rAn old cook shakes a spoon at you. "I told ya to stay outa here!"\r
\rCookie tips a bucket of hot grease on you. "I said you would regret it!" he cackles.\r
\rThe old chef cowers. "Lemme alone!"\r
\rIf you go for the mayor, go to the top floor. You'll need explosives.\r
\rCookie waves at you. Go on, you have no business here and you might slip in the grease.\r
\rWhatcha doing back here again? Beat it!\r
\rThe door is stenciled "Housekeeping".\r
\rLeaving Stagecoach Inn.\r
"So I can be sure you are okay, tell me what you said to Mom, or what she said to you."\r
URAQT2
URABUTLN
NO
\r"You are all okay. We must be careful. I am sure you will free our town. Take what is on the table. It will help you free our town."\r
\rLaurie spins her wheelchair and says, "Good luck. I won't be here if you return."\r
\rThere is a plain table here.\r
\r"The hostages are on the 3rd floor of the courthouse. A back stairway goes up from the 1st floor."\r
\r"The stairs are in the file room. The doors are steel and they are not heavily protected."\r
\r"We have learned that the password into the courthouse is MUERTE."\r
\rYou realize she was a 20-year old woman in a wheelchair! You scum...\r
\rShe glares at you as she dies. "You would have done better with my help, were you more sensible."\r
\rYou splintered the door without realizing someone was behind it.\r
\rA young woman sprawls from her wheelchair, a spear of wood protruding from her throat.\r
\rThe shelf is dusty but empty.\r
\rThis wood cabinet is empty.\r
\rYou happened to glance under the bed. Fortunately, the maid forgot to clean under there!\r
"What are you are doing here?" snarls an outlaw. "Git em, Wolf!" he orders his dog.\r
"Chugbum, it is time for target practice," says one outlaw.\r
\rA bum stops you. "Bub, ya got some for me? I would shore appreshiate some."\r
\rThe bum beams. "Thank ye kindly! Over there is a trap door."\r
\rWhat am I supposed to do with that? Can't ya spare a little?\r
\rYou see bums sleeping in the alley.\r
\rA pile of junk leans against the fence. Poking at it scares out some rats.\r
\rBehind a shattered table is a trap door.\r
\rYou are extremely fortunate. You fail to disarm it but it does not blow up.\r
\rYou are fortunate...\r
\rYou cut the right wire and disarmed the booby trap.\r
\rBums have been living here. This place looks like a pigsty.\r
A mad-eyed bum lurches toward you, screaming wildly.\r
The bums share quarters with mangy mongrels. Smelling strangers, the dogs circle warily, then leap.\r
From a heap beside the chair, bums and curs together leap for your throat.\r
"Whaddya want?" he gawps. "Don't hurt me, I am nice, I talk if you talk..."\r
CHAT
MONEY
SNAKE SQUEEZINS
GANG
SECRET
MAYOR
COURTHOUSE
BACK WAY
\rHis eyes unfocus. "Huh? What wazzat?" he asks, shaking his head.\r
\rA young bum is curled up around an empty jug. He is startled by your presence.\r
\r"I got no money, nor Squeeze," he whines. "But I got a secret. The gang don't know."\r
\rReally, I got nothing. But old Fred hid something in the chair I think.\r
\r"They got Mayor Pedros at the Courthouse. I found a back way they did not know."\r
\r"The secret way to the Courthouse is through Housekeeping at the back of the alley."\r
\rYou shake the bum. His eyes cross and he passes out.\r
\rYou look underneath and find...\r
\rHis eyes fire wildly. "Give me your Squeeze?" he demands.\r
\rHe grabs the tonic and drinks it all.\r
\rThis is room #
\rThe room is hung with camo cloth. You hear someone but cannot see anyone!\r
\rA man works at the table. "I am writing the Last Great American Novel."\r
"We will kill to give him that chance!"\r
\rSeveral people watch. "The writer," they say "is a great man. Do not bother him."\r
\r"Do not bother him! His novel will bring Peace In Our Time!"\r
\rThere is a chainlink fence here.\r
\rSmack! You walk into a brick wall.\r
\rYou startle a woman in a wheelchair. "Hi, I am Laurie," she says. "My mom Ellen said you would come by."\r
Look out! They're gonna carve you into cold cuts.\r
A gunman squints at you. "I'm Squint and you are dead."\r
\rStay off the desk.\r
\rYou step across splintered railing.\r
\r"You're not allowed back here! My dogs will getcha," yells the clerk as he runs away.\r
The clerk pulls his pistol.\r
The pit bulls leap with jaws agape.\r
\rThe floor is blasted open.\r
\rYou blew it -- literally!\r
Mulefoot rushes at you. "I work for Ugly. I don't have to take that!" he snarls.\r
The thugs pull guns. "We don't like people hanging around our table. Blow off!"\r
\rThis is a steel counter. Heat lamps obscure your view into the kitchen.\r
\rYou rip off an old man! "That is my best cleaver," he moans.\r
\rHe sniffles and takes it. Maybe you are not so bad after all.\r
\rHe throws an orange at you.\r
\rBye. And be careful of the grease.\r
\rThe floor is slippery with grease.\r
\rYou slipped, cracking your head on the edge of the counter.\r
\rLaurie says, "You must prove you are worth our help. Bring a servomotor for my chair. Then I will help."\r
\rLaurie is delighted with the servomotor to power her wheelchair. Thank you!\r
\r"No," she says. "Nothing else will do."\r
\rA voice says, "If you step inside, you will be blown to Kingdom Come."\r
\rFrom the room a grenade is lobbed at your feet.\r
"I can see you better than you can see me," the woman snarls, and her twin 45s roar!\r
\r"You have 2 chances to convince me not to shoot you," says the hidden woman.\r
\r"Not good enough," she growls.\r
\r"That's it!" she cries. "You are no better than the thugs!"\r
\rYou see nothing unusual here.\r
\rThe shelves have a few bottles of soapy solutions.\r
\rThese shelves have cans of chemicals.\r
\rThis is a classy hotel. There are packs of paper strips to put around toilet seats.\r
\rYou find a locked wood cabinet.\r
\rJust as you open the door, you hear a voice behind you.\r
Two housekeepers yell "You have no business here!" and prepare to pummel you!\r
\rExplosives are packed inside this...\r
This is the Obliterator's room! Get out or die!\r
\r"Thanks a lot."\r
